subject: Physical Fitness
title: Chinese Martial Arts and Qigong
description: A quick win: understand Chinese Martial Arts and Qigong.

hook.text: In a Shaolin monastery, monks trained their bodies as fiercely as their minds. Fitness was spiritual discipline.

buildup.text: Chinese martial arts combined combat skills with breath control, flexibility, and internal energy cultivation.

twist.text: Tai chi was originally a martial art, not gentle exercise. Its slow form masks combat applications in every movement.

climax.text: Modern research shows tai chi improves balance, reduces falls, and lowers blood pressure. The ancients were right.

punchline.text: Ancient Chinese exercise married body, breath, and mind. Science is catching up.
